projects.title: Crop Monitoring Smart Agriculture
projects.description: Crop Monitoring Smart Agriculture optimizes fertilizer application with a portable device measuring key soil parameters. An Android app (Flutter) visualizes data, including plant leaf disease detection, transmitted via Bluetooth Low Energy. Hardware includes Arduino Uno, DHT22 sensor, soil moisture sensor, and HC-05 Bluetooth module.

projects.title: The Bank App
projects.description: TheBankApp extends banking reach with mobile devices, enabling essential services like withdrawals, deposits, and balance inquiries through local agents. It syncs transactions with a centralized database, supports account management, interest calculation, and offers fixed deposit plans. User-friendly interfaces enhance accessibility.

projects.title: Spiking Neural Network on FPGA
projects.description: This project implements a Spiking Neural Network (SNN) on FPGA for real-time image processing. Using VHDL, it mimics biological neuron behavior, optimized for color detection like crosswalks. Python aids in training and normalization. Future steps include resolving detection issues and expanding to video frame analysis for driver alerts.

projects.title: Fish Tank Monitoring System
projects.description: The Fish Tank Monitoring System comprises pH and turbidity monitoring, and automated feeding. The pH meter, using an Arduino and RaspberryPi, detects pH levels and alerts via an Android app. Turbidity is assessed through image processing. The feeding system, controlled by a servo motor, offers scheduled or manual feeding.

projects.title: N-Puzzle
projects.description: N-Puzzle involves rearranging tiles on a board using the A* algorithm. The task focuses on a variant with two vacancies. Randomly generated test cases are analyzed using heuristics like misplaced tiles and Manhattan Distance, showing no significant difference. Statistical analysis confirms this using Python libraries.

projects.title: Canny Edge Detection
projects.description: Canny Edge Detection in Python is an image processing technique developed from scratch. It identifies edges through grayscale conversion, Gaussian blurring, gradient estimation, non-maximum suppression, and dual thresholding. Ideal for computer vision tasks, it requires Python, NumPy, and Matplotlib for implementation.
